main event: On 17 May 1958 in Kisalon, Mindanao, Philippines, a very bright silvery bluish round object was observed diving off, emitting rays all around, and covering a 50-degree arc in less than 1 minute. The object seemed to linger before dashing down again and was observed by Father Riesner, a society of Jesuits.
interesting points: The object was observed moving in a manner that appeared to be guided, sparking uncertainty about its origin.
The object was more brilliant than Venus and seemed to exhibit fluctuation in atmospheric conditions.
The report includes comments speculating about the object possibly being a balloon, aircraft, meteor, or astronomical in nature, leaving the conclusion as unknown.

Father Labrador made a separate observation of a bright, sharply defined phenomenon that moved from east to west, and it was suggested that it could be related to re-entry techniques used by the Russians.
Despite ground observation teams being sent to the area, no additional significant information was obtained about the sighting.
sighted object: A very bright silvery bluish round object
